Songun Policy Praised by American Study Group
articles.content:
Songun Policy Praised by American Study Group 
    Pyongyang, September 24 (KCNA) -- The U.S. Group for the Study of Songun Politics posted photos of leader Kim Jong Il and articles praising the Songun policy on its Internet homepage.
 Seen on the homepage was an article titled "Songun, great banner of cause of independence" which said that the Songun policy of Korea serves as an ever-victorious treasured sword for firmly protecting independence and justice and victoriously advancing the cause of socialism.    
 The homepage in another article captioned "Songun policy based on the Juche idea" stressed it is thanks to the Songun policy that the DPRK is dynamically pushing forward the building of a great prosperous powerful nation,  foiling the U.S. moves to isolate and stifle it.

84th Anti-U.S. Solidarity Meeting Held in S. Korea
articles.content:
84th Anti-U.S. Solidarity Meeting Held in S. Korea 
    Pyongyang, September 23 (KCNA) -- The 84th anti-U.S. solidarity meeting was reportedly held in south Korea on Sept. 19.
 Speakers at the meeting recalled that a preliminary meeting of the south Korea-U.S. "annual security consultative council" and the 10th "meeting on security policy initiative" are scheduled to take place in Washington D.C. on Sept. 27 and 28, adding that the meetings would adversely affect the destiny of the Korean nation as they are a starting point for rounding off the discussion on the revamping of the south Korea-U.S. "alliance" which has been under way for the past several years and implementing what has been proposed there.    
 Urging the present "government" to stop at once boosting the "alliance" with the U.S. in contravention of the June 15 joint declaration but opt for national cooperation, they denounced the forcible removal of dwelling houses for the expansion of the U.S. military base in Phyongthaek and transfer of the U.S. bomb-dropping range in Maehyang-ri to Jik Islet and declared they would take an active part in the 4th grand march for peace.
 A protest letter to the U.S. ambassador to south Korea was read out.
 The letter demanded the U.S. halt the expansion of its military base in Phyongthaek, cancel its project for "strategic flexibility" and abrogate the south Korea-U.S. "mutual defense treaty."

Adherence to Revolutionary Principle in Standoff with Imperialism Called for
articles.content:
Adherence to Revolutionary Principle in Standoff with Imperialism Called for
    Pyongyang, September 23 (KCNA) -- All countries and nations aspiring after independence should not stand back even a step but courageously struggle against the imperialists to win a victory in the cause for independence against imperialism.
 Rodong Sinmun today says this in a by-lined article. It goes on:
 Any concession in the revolutionary principle means surrender and death. Had some countries which advocated socialism in the past remained true to the revolutionary principle, there would not have been such tragic events as the breakdown of ruling parties, collapse of socialism and the yielding to the imperialists.    
 What happened in Iraq clearly shows what disastrous consequences are entailed by any act of abandoning the revolutionary principle. The imperialists resort to more vicious and cunning methods in order to invade and plunder other countries and nations. Without a struggle against imperialism, is it impossible to achieve and defend and consolidate the national independence, establish an independent regime and adopt and implement any line and policy in keeping with the desire and will of the people and to ensure the independent development of country and national prosperity. Confrontation with the imperialists is unavoidable unless they abandon their aggressive and predatory nature. So, there will be no other way but to stand firm against them without any concession or retreat. The stronger pressure the imperialists put, the more resolutely each country and nation should meet them, without being frightened or stepping back. Only by doing so, it is possible to win in the standoff
  with the imperialists. This is immutable truth.    
 Imperialism is by no means strong. One should never get frightened by the desperate efforts made by the imperialists on the verge of ruin. Victory is always in store for those countries and nations resolutely fighting against imperialism.

Greetings to President of Guinea-Bissau
articles.content:
Greetings to President of Guinea-Bissau
    Pyongyang, September 23  (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, sent a message of greetings to Joao Bernardo Vieira, president of Guinea-Bissau , on September 20 on the occasion of the 33rd anniversary of the proclamation of the Republic of Guinea-Bissau.
 Expressing the belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would continue developing on good terms, the message sincerely wished him greater success in his responsible work for national unity and social stability.
